result.execSummary:
The defendant Davonnis Marquise Mitchell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, pay related surcharges.  Court costs and victim witness surcharges. ALL To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 6/23/2018.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.   Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davonnis Marquise Mitchell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (45 pages) commencing JUNE 23, 2014 received and filed. kl

Defendant Davonnis Marquise Mitchell in court with Gabriela Leija appeared under the student practice rule and under the supervision of attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Davonnis Marquise Mitchell in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
  Defendant  advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED and READ IN.
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 123 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/23/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 6/23/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Davonnis Marquise Mitchell not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/23/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15. Court vacates trial date.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Davonnis Marquise Mitchell not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record discussions held.  Triasl dates are to remain at this time.  Defense is to submit a written bail motion for the courts consideration.  No additional action at this time.
for Bail Reduction or Modification, signed and filed. sab
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Attorney Anne M. Jaspers in court, defendant Davonnis Marquise Mitchell not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 5/2/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 5/14/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Davonnis Marquise Mitchell in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Davonnis Marquise Mitchell in custody.  Paul Hauer for Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Davonnis Marquise Mitchell in court with attorney Anne Jaspers.  Defendant Davonnis Marquise Mitchell in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
